But I mean I’m not complaining.

summary: I have the same excitement for Elu that I had for malec in season one HELP
question: I have the same excitement for Elu that I had for malec in season one HELP
answer: I feel this!! What makes me both excited and anxious is knowing that they changed like 50% from the OG season so now I am like… OMG what happens now and I know what happens but also… will it? It’s killing me! Same with their chemistry! The staring contest at the party had me dead on the floor like… gawd. I am so not prepared for the rest!

summary: What do you think having Lisa and especially Mika being so awful to Lucas will mean for him? Will he become closer with other...
question: What do you think having Lisa and especially Mika being so awful to Lucas will mean for him? Will he become closer with other characters or are we supposed to wait for them to be redeemed too? It’s just making me so sad for Lucas :(
answer:
I was actually wondering about this earlier. The writers have to know that they are writing Mika and Lisa to be unlikable, unsympathetic characters, so I do wonder their intention. I expect there is going to be a scene later on, when Lucas is heartbroken or whatever, that Mika is going to come through and maybe sit with him, maybe apologize and tell him that he is family and family doesn’t belong alone or whatever. and then the audience is supposed to have this “ah ha” moment that Mika isn’t such a bad guy etc etc. 

But the point remains that the words spoken today were meant to isolate Lucas and to show the audience that right now, he doesn’t really belong anywhere. This is very different than the way they handled Isak and Marti, but I’ve always thought that Lucas was meant to showcase the extreme isolating factors of being a closeted teenage boy in an incredibly homophobic country. Lucas is more extreme than either of the other boys in the internalized homophobia and external toxic-masculinity, and extreme loneliness. 

Today’s clip was just that fact hitting home.

tags: bruh this was supposed to be one paragraph
summary:
I love how each of the dance scenes relate to the earlier part of the night in the og and the remakes. 
Even was the least...
body:
I love how each of the dance scenes relate to the earlier part of the night in the og and the remakes. 

Even was the least aggressive when he arrives at the party. On the couch, he says something nice about the apartment then confronts Emma - and his comments about stereotyping gay people address some of Isak’s own concerns about his identity so Isak takes something positive from the experience. When they’re dancing and Even looks up, Isak’s shocked because it’s the boldest thing Even’s done so far to show his interest, a real provocation that demands a answer - will he keep looking or look away? It’s probably the most intense of the three scenes because our pov character is overwhelmed as this is the first real and unquestionable sign of Even’s interest (of course there have been many but Isak could think he’d read them wrong, whereas staring intently as you kiss someone can’t really be misread as anything else). 

Eliott already arrives with his passive-aggressive mec in a clear response to Lucas’ actions the day before. Lucas keeps his eye on him while he’s dancing and looks really miserable as he sees Eliott having fun - he’s supposed to be enjoying himself too, because he got in way too deep with this girl he doesn’t care for and now he has to go along with his own bullshit. And it sucks because only a week before he showed a real and intimate part of himself and he thought he felt a connection there up to the last moment when he realized Eliott had a girlfriend. So he kisses Chloe and it’s him that looks at Eliott, almost hoping Eliott will look over. And Eliott does, and only then starts kissing Lucille (you can almost hear him thinking oh yeah? I’ll show you a kiss) - in the same way that he teased Lucas earlier as a reaction to what Lucas did first. Lucas is looking for an answer and soon he’ll get a painfully obvious hint to Eliott’s intentions (take the hint boy), but for now he only stares and tries to play his role and becomes more and more aware that he can’t do it and that he made a mistake with Chloe, because it’s Eliott that he wants. 

Meanwhile, Nico is no doubt the biggest asshole when he drops on that couch, physically separating Marti and Emma and teasing him about boring gays - which is a reaction to Martino kissing Emma only when he turned in his direction, which in turn was Martino’s reaction to him kissing Maddalena at his house after flirting with him all afternoon and refusing his invitation to go out earlier that week. When they start dancing, Martino looks annoyed and a little pissed. He stares at Nico and Maddalena and has to be pulled by Emma into a kiss but he’s not even trying - he never really tried with Emma - and is just waiting to see if this new challenge is going to be met. And of course Nico looks over. So he’s not shocked, and Nico’s not shocked, but neither of them are enjoying the provocation either at this point - in fact, there’s a second when Nico drops the act and looks very unsatisfied with the situation before he recovers and turns back smiling to Maddalena (the same way as we saw him sad and alone on the couch after Marti and Emma got up). So while in the other scenes it’s mostly Even/Eliott leaving Isak/Lucas Shook™, with Marti and Nico it’s both of them going on another round of their push and pull. 

In conclusion: I love all of these scenes and how they fit into their stories.

When they start dancing, Martino looks annoyed and a little pissed. He stares at Nico and Maddalena and has to be pulled by Emma into a kiss but he’s not even trying - he never really tried with Emma - and is just waiting to see if this new challenge is going to be met. And of course Nico looks over. So he’s not shocked, and Nico’s not shocked, but neither of them are enjoying the provocation either at this point - in fact, there’s a second when Nico drops the act and looks very unsatisfied with the situation before he recovers and turns back smiling to Maddalena (the same way as we saw him sad and alone on the couch after Marti and Emma got up). So while in the other scenes it’s mostly Even/Eliott leaving Isak/Lucas Shook™, with Marti and Nico it’s both of them going on another round of their push and pull. 

In conclusion: I love all of these scenes and how they fit into their stories.

summary: Guys let’s get the france tv slash channel to 100k!!
title: Guys let’s get the france tv slash channel to 100k!!

summary: When they were at the bus stop, Eliott said the foyer was a good place to "meet" people while staring longingly at Lucas. Like...
body: When they were at the bus stop, Eliott said the foyer was a good place to “meet” people while staring longingly at Lucas. Like Even, he totally went to the meeting with the only hope of finally meeting his small boy. I hope he tells Lucas that, like Even said it to Isak!
